The Goods!

Check out some of my work. Below you'll find a selection of handpicked print and interactive projects. If you would like to see more of my work you can check out my blog. Enjoy and have a nice day!

Previous Project Next Project

  • Amorae Bridal

    Web design & development

    Amorae Bridal is an award winning bridal shop located in Essex, United Kingdom. Amorae wanted me to design and build their website from the ground up. Their key requirements included a mobile friendly site, a platform to involve with their brides and an engaging user experience. One of the challenges that came with this project was the sheer mass of images on the site, I foreseen this complication so was able to ensure that all image were meticulously optimised. Check out the live site here.

    Amorae Bridal

    Web design & development

  • Copan

    Design

    Copan is an extremely popular bar in south Dublin. I designed this TV advert to advertise their great new deal on craft beers. I used a rustic hipster-esque background with different shades of brown tie in with the colours of their brand and hit home with their target audience.

    Copan

    Design

  • Ongar

    Branding

    I was commissioned to design a business brochure for the town of Ongar (Essex) and this was the branding that accompanied it. The client requested something that was "uncluttered, trendy and easily recognisable". I achieved this by using the infamous map pin icon and a flat red colour to keep it current and trendy. To remove the main emphasis from the map pin I spit it with the text for the business directory.

    Ongar

    Branding

  • Ongar

    Design & Print

    I designed the Ongar Christmas lights programme in 2012. This was a 6 page fold out brochure which included children’s games, jokes and a full year planner on the reverse. The theme was 1000 Santa’s and the cover had hundreds of little Santa clause. The 2012 Christmas lights brochure was received extremely well and I was re-commissioned to design their business directory.

    Ongar

    Design & Print

  • English42

    Web design & development

    The people at English42 approached me to redesign and rebuild their website on a new e-commerce platform. They offer exam correction along with 1 to 1 Skype sessions and wanted their customers to be able to book these sessions online to reduce the amount of admin hours they previously spent phoning customers to confirm bookings. I build the site using Wordpress, Woo-commerce Bookly and Stripe to meet the clients requirements. Check out the Live site.

    English42

    Web design & development

  • Weight Watchers

    Design

    This was a concept design for weight watchers. The idea behind it was to point out the struggle of dieting, how difficult it can be for people but no matter how dark it can get the grass is always greener. This was a fun personal project between client work and I learn a few things from the entire process.

    Weight Watchers

    Design

  • Slievemore Clinic

    Web design & development

    Slievemore Clinic is located in south Dublin, they wanted a new responsive solution for their website that was easy to update, cost effective but professional. I built them a one page Wordpress site to accommodate their needs and added the main navigation to give the impression of a larger site. The client had a very limited computer knowledge so I used the divi theme from elegant themes for ease of use. Check out the Live site.

    Slievemore Clinic

    Web design & development

  • Barclay Club

    Design & Print

    Barclay Club is a gentlemen's club located in Dublin's city centre. They want some marketing material for their €25 Christmas promotion. They requested a PG flyer that would also entise their upper class clientel. I have also contributed to the design/development of their website which you can see here.

    Barclay Club

    Design & Print

  • Ériu

    Web design & development

    Ériu is a public relations and digital marketing company that contacted me for a bespoke responsive website in both English and Gaelic. They wanted a simple website that used subtle animations that enticed users engagement. I achieved this using HTML5 CSS3 and jQuery.

    Ériu

    Web design & development

Hello

I'm Mike, a front-end developer & designer. I studied Digital Media at Edinburgh Napier University and gratuated in 2010. I have lived in London, Edinburgh, Australia and I'm currently back at home in Dublin, Ireland. I have been self employed for a number of years and during that time I provided small to medium businesses with print and interactive solutions. In 2015 I started working for Nettl as a Brand Stylist. In my free time I like to watch Boxing, annoy my kitten and design posts for my blog.
